definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Their personality bearing and the nobility of the character compels obedience naturally.
sentences.chinese: 他们的气质举止和高尚的性格让人们自然而然地折服。

sentences.english: They are like twins both in appearance and in behavior.
sentences.chinese: 外貌还是举止都活似双胞胎。

sentences.english: Her behavior returned to normal after the quake.
sentences.chinese: 她的举止在地震结束后就恢复了正常。

sentences.english: He acts as if he owned the place.
sentences.chinese: 他的举止行为就好像他是那个地方的主人。

sentences.english: He thinks they behave impudently and always ask for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 以为高加索人举止粗鲁，常寻事端。

sentences.english: Don't let the repoter spook you, and you have to behave urbanely.
sentences.chinese: 别让记者缠住你，而你还得举止文雅。
他滑稽地模仿那个政客的举止。

sentences.english: This behaviour is not conducive to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 这种举止行为不可能认真勤奋地工作。

sentences.english: Zhou Youping face the same good behavior, and the lady is no different.
sentences.chinese: 周友平面容姣好，行为举止，与淑女无异。

sentences.english: He remarked how odd it was to see someone who looks and acts like him.
sentences.chinese: 他说，看到有人长相和举止都像自己，觉得怪怪的。

sentences.english: I love to watch their mannerisms and interactions with each other.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢观察它们的举止和互动。

sentences.english: He was behaving normally in spite of his anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他心中焦急，但仍然举止如常。

sentences.english: It was the spy's suspicious manner that first put us on to him.
sentences.chinese: 最初引起我们对这个间谍警惕的是他的可疑的举止。
霸王龙的行为举止什么样？

sentences.english: The students deported themselves in a mannerly way.

definition: words and actions/what one says and what one does
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
